page.title: 04 CORNALEES COUNTRY PARK
page.content:
{CORNALEES BRIDGE COUNTRY PARK
THE CORNALEES BRIDGE INFORMATION CENTRE LIES AT THE TOP OF SHIELHILL GLEN. FROM THE CENTRE A TRAIL LEADS ALONG THE BANKS OF THE HISTORIC GREENOCK CUT, AN AQUEDUCT WHICH ONCE CARRIED WATER FROM LOCH THOM TO GREENOCK, AND WHICH HAS RECENTLY BEEN DESIGNATED AS A "NATIONAL MONUMENT". THE TRAIL TURNS AWAY FROM THE CUT AND GOES DOWN INTO SHIELHILL GLEN WHICH HAS BEEN DESIGNATED AS A SITE OF "SPECIAL SCIENTIFIC INTEREST"-AS IT IS ONE OF THE FEW NATURAL HARDWOOD GLENS IN THIS PART OF SCOTLAND. TYPICAL TREES ARE ASH, BIRCH, OAK AND ROWAN. ON CLIMBING OUT OF THE GLEN ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE KIP BURN, THE TRAIL RETURNS THROUGH THE HEATHER MOORLAND WHICH IS SHEEP FARMING COUNTRY.
